snippet: More companies and organizations are taking extra precautions when employees travel in China and Russia. Many are now forbidding them to take laptops and smartphones because they are easily hacked.
abstract: More companies and organizations are taking extra precautions when employees travel in China and Russia. Many are now forbidding them to take laptops and smartphones because they are easily hacked.
lead_paragraph: What might have once sounded like the behavior of a paranoid is now standard operating procedure for officials at American government agencies, research groups and companies that do business in China and Russia, reports Nicole Perlroth of The New York Times. Employees are warned not to travel with laptops or smartphones because they are too easily hacked.Read more »

headline.main: Traveling Light in Russia and China Because of Digital Thievery
